title: Drawing, "A meal in the country", 1600–25
medium: Charcoal, pen, ink, brush, grey watercolor, paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical rectangle. A horizontal oblong with three dancing children. At right is one blowing into a trumpet. Below is a scrollwork frame of a [?] ovoid. On top is a helmet, whose mantling ends with ribbons and tassels. Two framing lines. Verso: Most of the right half is executed; the left one roughly outlined. Five persons, possibly all women, sit at a table in the open country. One of them raises a glass. At right is a tree, a house in the background.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "A meal in the country", 1600–25.Charcoal, pen, ink, brush, grey watercolor, paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1801.
